intro: Fagonia sinaica var. longipes, commonly known as the Sinai fagonia, is a shrub native to the arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately compound leaves. The plant is well adapted to dry, rocky soils and can thrive in harsh desert conditions. This species is of interest in botanical studies due to its ecological resilience and potential medicinal properties.
